page.name: page
page.summary: The @page at-rule is a CSS at-rule used to modify different aspects of a printed page property. It targets and modifies the page's dimensions, page orientation, and margins. The @page at-rule can be used to target all pages in a print-out, or even specific ones using its various pseudo-classes.
page.title: @page

page.name: page-break-after
page.summary: The page-break-after CSS property adjusts page breaks after the current element.
page.title: page-break-after

page.name: page-break-before
page.summary: The page-break-before CSS property adjusts page breaks before the current element.
page.title: page-break-before

dimension-properties.name: block-size
dimension-properties.summary: The block-size CSS property defines the horizontal or vertical size of an element's block, depending on its writing mode. It corresponds to either the width or the height property, depending on the value of writing-mode.
dimension-properties.title: block-size

dimension-properties.name: inline-size
dimension-properties.summary: The inline-size CSS property defines the horizontal or vertical size of an element's block, depending on its writing mode. It corresponds to either the width or the height property, depending on the value of writing-mode.
dimension-properties.title: inline-size

propdef-border-block-color.name: border-block-color
propdef-border-block-color.summary: The border-block-color CSS property defines the color of the logical block borders of an element, which maps to a physical border color depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-color and border-bottom-color, or border-right-color and border-left-color property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-border-block-color.title: border-block-color

border-color.name: border-block-end-color
border-color.summary: The border-block-end-color CSS property defines the color of the logical block-end border of an element, which maps to a physical border color depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-color, border-right-color, border-bottom-color, or border-left-color property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
border-color.title: border-block-end-color

border-color.name: border-block-start-color
border-color.summary: The border-block-start-color CSS property defines the color of the logical block-start border of an element, which maps to a physical border color depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-color, border-right-color, border-bottom-color, or border-left-color property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
border-color.title: border-block-start-color

border-color.name: border-inline-end-color
border-color.summary: The border-inline-end-color CSS property defines the color of the logical inline-end border of an element, which maps to a physical border color depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-color, border-right-color, border-bottom-color, or border-left-color property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
border-color.title: border-inline-end-color

border-color.name: border-inline-start-color
border-color.summary: The border-inline-start-color CSS property defines the color of the logical inline start border of an element, which maps to a physical border color depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-color, border-right-color, border-bottom-color, or border-left-color property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
border-color.title: border-inline-start-color

border-style.name: border-block-end-style
border-style.summary: The border-block-end-style CSS property defines the style of the logical block-end border of an element, which maps to a physical border style depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-style, border-right-style, border-bottom-style, or border-left-style property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
border-style.title: border-block-end-style

border-style.name: border-block-start-style
border-style.summary: The border-block-start-style CSS property defines the style of the logical block start border of an element, which maps to a physical border style depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-style, border-right-style, border-bottom-style, or border-left-style property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
border-style.title: border-block-start-style

border-style.name: border-inline-end-style
border-style.summary: The border-inline-end-style CSS property defines the style of the logical inline end border of an element, which maps to a physical border style depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-style, border-right-style, border-bottom-style, or border-left-style property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
border-style.title: border-inline-end-style

border-style.name: border-inline-start-style
border-style.summary: The border-inline-start-style CSS property defines the style of the logical inline start border of an element, which maps to a physical border style depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-style, border-right-style, border-bottom-style, or border-left-style property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
border-style.title: border-inline-start-style

border-width.name: border-block-end-width
border-width.summary: The border-block-end-width CSS property defines the width of the logical block-end border of an element, which maps to a physical border width depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-width, border-right-width, border-bottom-width, or border-left-width property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
border-width.title: border-block-end-width

border-width.name: border-block-start-width
border-width.summary: The border-block-start-width CSS property defines the width of the logical block-start border of an element, which maps to a physical border width depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-width, border-right-width, border-bottom-width, or border-left-width property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
border-width.title: border-block-start-width

border-width.name: border-inline-end-width
border-width.summary: The border-inline-end-width CSS property defines the width of the logical inline-end border of an element, which maps to a physical border width depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-width, border-right-width, border-bottom-width, or border-left-width property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
border-width.title: border-inline-end-width

border-width.name: border-inline-start-width
border-width.summary: The border-inline-start-width CSS property defines the width of the logical inline-start border of an element, which maps to a physical border width depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-width, border-right-width, border-bottom-width, or border-left-width property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
border-width.title: border-inline-start-width

border-shorthands.name: border-block-end
border-shorthands.summary: The border-block-end CSS property is a shorthand property for setting the individual logical block-end border property values in a single place in the style sheet.
border-shorthands.title: border-block-end

border-shorthands.name: border-block-start
border-shorthands.summary: The border-block-start CSS property is a shorthand property for setting the individual logical block-start border property values in a single place in the style sheet.
border-shorthands.title: border-block-start

border-shorthands.name: border-inline-end
border-shorthands.summary: The border-inline-end CSS property is a shorthand property for setting the individual logical inline-end border property values in a single place in the style sheet.
border-shorthands.title: border-inline-end

border-shorthands.name: border-inline-start
border-shorthands.summary: The border-inline-start CSS property is a shorthand property for setting the individual logical inline-start border property values in a single place in the style sheet.
border-shorthands.title: border-inline-start

propdef-border-block-style.name: border-block-style
propdef-border-block-style.summary: The border-block-style CSS property defines the style of the logical block borders of an element, which maps to a physical border style depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-style and border-bottom-style, or border-left-style and border-right-style properties depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-border-block-style.title: border-block-style

propdef-border-block-width.name: border-block-width
propdef-border-block-width.summary: The border-block-width CSS property defines the width of the logical block borders of an element, which maps to a physical border width depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-width and border-bottom-width, or border-left-width, and border-right-width property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-border-block-width.title: border-block-width

propdef-border-block.name: border-block
propdef-border-block.summary: The border-block CSS property is a shorthand property for setting the individual logical block border property values in a single place in the style sheet.
propdef-border-block.title: border-block

logical-shorthand-keyword.name: border-color
logical-shorthand-keyword.summary: The border-color shorthand CSS property sets the color of an element's border.

firefox.notes: Firefox also supports the following non-standard CSS properties to set the border sides to multiple colors: -moz-border-top-colors, -moz-border-right-colors, -moz-border-bottom-colors, -moz-border-left-colors

logical-shorthand-keyword.title: border-color

border-radius-properties.name: border-end-end-radius
border-radius-properties.summary: The border-end-end-radius CSS property defines a logical border radius on an element, which maps to a physical border radius that depends on the element's writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation. This is useful when building styles to work regardless of the text orientation and writing mode.
border-radius-properties.title: border-end-end-radius

border-radius-properties.name: border-end-start-radius
border-radius-properties.summary: The border-end-start-radius CSS property defines a logical border radius on an element, which maps to a physical border radius depending on the element's writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation. This is useful when building styles to work regardless of the text orientation and writing mode.
border-radius-properties.title: border-end-start-radius

border-radius-properties.name: border-start-end-radius
border-radius-properties.summary: The border-start-end-radius CSS property defines a logical border radius on an element, which maps to a physical border radius depending on the element's writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation. This is useful when building styles to work regardless of the text orientation and writing mode.
border-radius-properties.title: border-start-end-radius

border-radius-properties.name: border-start-start-radius
border-radius-properties.summary: The border-start-start-radius CSS property defines a logical border radius on an element, which maps to a physical border radius that depends on the element's writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation. This is useful when building styles to work regardless of the text orientation and writing mode.
border-radius-properties.title: border-start-start-radius

propdef-border-inline-color.name: border-inline-color
propdef-border-inline-color.summary: The border-inline-color CSS property defines the color of the logical inline borders of an element, which maps to a physical border color depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-color and border-bottom-color, or border-right-color and border-left-color property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-border-inline-color.title: border-inline-color

propdef-border-inline-style.name: border-inline-style
propdef-border-inline-style.summary: The border-inline-style CSS property defines the style of the logical inline borders of an element, which maps to a physical border style depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-style and border-bottom-style, or border-left-style and border-right-style properties depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-border-inline-style.title: border-inline-style

propdef-border-inline-width.name: border-inline-width
propdef-border-inline-width.summary: The border-inline-width CSS property defines the width of the logical inline borders of an element, which maps to a physical border width depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-width and border-bottom-width, or border-left-width, and border-right-width property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-border-inline-width.title: border-inline-width

propdef-border-inline.name: border-inline
propdef-border-inline.summary: The border-inline CSS property is a shorthand property for setting the individual logical inline border property values in a single place in the style sheet.
propdef-border-inline.title: border-inline

caption-side.name: caption-side
caption-side.summary: The caption-side CSS property puts the content of a table's <caption> on the specified side. The values are relative to the writing-mode of the table.
caption-side.title: caption-side

float-clear.name: clear
float-clear.summary: The clear CSS property sets whether an element must be moved below (cleared) floating elements that precede it. The clear property applies to floating and non-floating elements.
float-clear.title: clear

float-clear.name: float
float-clear.summary: The float CSS property places an element on the left or right side of its container, allowing text and inline elements to wrap around it. The element is removed from the normal flow of the page, though still remaining a part of the flow (in contrast to absolute positioning).
float-clear.title: float

position-properties.name: inset-block-end
position-properties.summary: The inset-block-end CSS property defines the logical block end offset of an element, which maps to a physical inset depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the top, right, bottom, or left property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
position-properties.title: inset-block-end

position-properties.name: inset-block-start
position-properties.summary: The inset-block-start CSS property defines the logical block start offset of an element, which maps to a physical inset depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the top, right, bottom, or left property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
position-properties.title: inset-block-start

position-properties.name: inset-inline-end
position-properties.summary: The inset-inline-end CSS property defines the logical inline end inset of an element, which maps to a physical offset depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the top, right, bottom, or left property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
position-properties.title: inset-inline-end

position-properties.name: inset-inline-start
position-properties.summary: The inset-inline-start CSS property defines the logical inline start inset of an element, which maps to a physical offset depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the top, right, bottom, or left property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
position-properties.title: inset-inline-start

propdef-inset-block.name: inset-block
propdef-inset-block.summary: The inset-block CSS property defines the logical block start and end offsets of an element, which maps to physical offsets depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the top and bottom, or right and left properties depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-inset-block.title: inset-block

propdef-inset-inline.name: inset-inline
propdef-inset-inline.summary: The inset-inline CSS property defines the logical start and end offsets of an element in the inline direction, which maps to physical offsets depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the top and bottom, or right and left properties depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-inset-inline.title: inset-inline

propdef-inset.name: inset
propdef-inset.summary: The inset CSS property is a shorthand that corresponds to the top, right, bottom, and/or left properties. It has the same multi-value syntax of the margin shorthand.
propdef-inset.title: inset

margin-properties.name: margin-block-end
margin-properties.summary: The margin-block-end CSS property defines the logical block end margin of an element, which maps to a physical margin depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation.
margin-properties.title: margin-block-end

margin-properties.name: margin-block-start
margin-properties.summary: The margin-block-start CSS property defines the logical block start margin of an element, which maps to a physical margin depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation.
margin-properties.title: margin-block-start

margin-properties.name: margin-inline-end
margin-properties.summary: The margin-inline-end CSS property defines the logical inline end margin of an element, which maps to a physical margin depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. In other words, it corresponds to the margin-top, margin-right, margin-bottom or margin-left property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
margin-properties.title: margin-inline-end

margin-properties.name: margin-inline-start
margin-properties.summary: The margin-inline-start CSS property defines the logical inline start margin of an element, which maps to a physical margin depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the margin-top, margin-right, margin-bottom, or margin-left property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
margin-properties.title: margin-inline-start

propdef-margin-block.name: margin-block
propdef-margin-block.summary: The margin-block CSS shorthand property defines the logical block start and end margins of an element, which maps to physical margins depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation.
propdef-margin-block.title: margin-block

propdef-margin-inline.name: margin-inline
propdef-margin-inline.summary: The margin-inline CSS shorthand property is a shorthand property that defines both the logical inline start and end margins of an element, which maps to physical margins depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation.
propdef-margin-inline.title: margin-inline

propdef-max-block-size.name: max-block-size
propdef-max-block-size.summary: The max-block-size CSS property specifies the maximum size of an element in the direction opposite that of the writing direction as specified by writing-mode. That is, if the writing direction is horizontal, then max-block-size is equivalent to max-height; if the writing direction is vertical, max-block-size is the same as max-width.
propdef-max-block-size.title: max-block-size

propdef-max-inline-size.name: max-inline-size
propdef-max-inline-size.summary: The max-inline-size CSS property defines the horizontal or vertical maximum size of an element's block, depending on its writing mode. It corresponds to either the max-width or the max-height property, depending on the value of writing-mode.
propdef-max-inline-size.title: max-inline-size

propdef-min-block-size.name: min-block-size
propdef-min-block-size.summary: The min-block-size CSS property defines the minimum horizontal or vertical size of an element's block, depending on its writing mode. It corresponds to either the min-width or the min-height property, depending on the value of writing-mode.
propdef-min-block-size.title: min-block-size

propdef-min-inline-size.name: min-inline-size
propdef-min-inline-size.summary: The min-inline-size CSS property defines the horizontal or vertical minimal size of an element's block, depending on its writing mode. It corresponds to either the min-width or the min-height property, depending on the value of writing-mode.
propdef-min-inline-size.title: min-inline-size

padding-properties.name: padding-block-end
padding-properties.summary: The padding-block-end CSS property defines the logical block end padding of an element, which maps to a physical padding depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation.
padding-properties.title: padding-block-end

padding-properties.name: padding-block-start
padding-properties.summary: The padding-block-start CSS property defines the logical block start padding of an element, which maps to a physical padding depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation.
padding-properties.title: padding-block-start

padding-properties.name: padding-inline-end
padding-properties.summary: The padding-inline-end CSS property defines the logical inline end padding of an element, which maps to a physical padding depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation.
padding-properties.title: padding-inline-end

padding-properties.name: padding-inline-start
padding-properties.summary: The padding-inline-start CSS property defines the logical inline start padding of an element, which maps to a physical padding depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation.
padding-properties.title: padding-inline-start

propdef-padding-block.name: padding-block
propdef-padding-block.summary: The padding-block CSS shorthand property defines the logical block start and end padding of an element, which maps to physical padding properties depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation.
propdef-padding-block.title: padding-block

propdef-padding-inline.name: padding-inline
propdef-padding-inline.summary: The padding-inline CSS shorthand property defines the logical inline start and end padding of an element, which maps to physical padding properties depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation.
propdef-padding-inline.title: padding-inline

text-align.name: text-align
text-align.summary: The text-align CSS property sets the horizontal alignment of the inline-level content inside a block element or table-cell box. This means it works like vertical-align but in the horizontal direction.
text-align.title: text-align
